currentRow.columnValue: When the stop button is pressed, the current pump stroke shall be completed prior to stopping the pump.
The drug reservoir holds liquid pain-killer supplied by the hospital pharmacy and loaded in to the PCA pump by the clinician.

The PCA pump shall continue to infuse for 10 minutes during interruption of mains electricity supply using battery backup, either continuously or spread over an hour. (Five minutes to recharge per minute using battery.)
Component failure must not harm patient (beyond stopping function).
The pump shall be able to deliver basal infusion at flows throughout the basal infusion flow range of Fbasal min = 1 to Fbasal max = 10 ml/hr.
A real-time clock must produce timestamps accurate to 10 ms.
Component failure must not harm patient (beyond stopping function).
A open door alarm shall be triggered when the reservoir door is opened while the pump is not stopped.

The drug library102 can be thought of as a lookup table that, given a drug name and a location, provides typical and safe limits of different infusion parameters. The drug library shall be determined by an authorized and authenticated hospital pharmacist
Hardware faults detected, but not masked, shall raise a fault alarm, stop pump, record it in the Fault Log, and display the reason for fault on the user interface.
The PCA pump shall resume prescribed infusion upon receiving an authenticated command through its ICE interface.
The PCA pump shall perform a power-on-self-test (POST) to assure system integrity after being turned on, yet before any infusion begins. Failure of POST shall raise a POST alarm, stop pump

The PCA pump shall continue to infuse for 10 minutes during interruption of mains electricity supply using battery backup, either continuously or spread over an hour. (Five minutes to recharge per minute using battery.)
Prescriptions that violate the soft limits of the drug in the drug library shall issue a visible and audible warning requiring a soft limit confirmation by the clinician.
The PCA pump shall measure drug , F(basal) flow within a tolerance of Fmdf tol = 0.1 ml/hr.
Drug container must have a valid prescription, filled by an authorized pharmacist, for the particular patient to be infused by the PCA pump.
